SEARCH
Package JSONHandling

Class LoadJson

java.lang.Object
JSONHandling.LoadJson
public class LoadJson extends Object
Utility class for loading and saving application data as JSON. Contains helpers to read/write JSONArray files and to convert JSON content into application model objects (Student, ExternalMember, Movie, MovieRental). Backwards-compatible with older JSON files that used numeric-only IDs.

      public LoadJson()

  • Method Details

    • readJSONArray

      public static org.json.JSONArray readJSONArray(File file)
      Reads a JSONArray from the provided file. If the file does not exist or cannot be read, an empty JSONArray is returned.
      Parameters:
      file - source file to read
      Returns:
      JSONArray parsed from file or empty JSONArray on error

    • saveJSONArray

      public static void saveJSONArray(File file, org.json.JSONArray array)
      Saves a JSONArray to the provided file path using pretty-print formatting.
      Parameters:
      file - destination file
      array - JSONArray to persist

    • loadStudents

      public static javafx.collections.ObservableList<Student> loadStudents(File studentFile)
      Load students from the given JSON file and convert to ObservableList. This method supports both legacy numeric IDs and the new external string IDs.
      Parameters:
      studentFile - file containing students JSON array
      Returns:
      ObservableList of Student objects

    • loadMembers

      public static javafx.collections.ObservableList<ExternalMember> loadMembers(File memberFile)
      Load external members from file and return as ObservableList. Handles legacy numeric IDs and ensures externalID is populated.
      Parameters:
      memberFile - source file
      Returns:
      ObservableList of ExternalMember

    • loadMovies

      public static javafx.collections.ObservableList<Movie> loadMovies(File movieFile)
      Load movies from file, populating Movie objects and externalID.
      Parameters:
      movieFile - file with movies JSON array
      Returns:
      ObservableList of Movie

    • loadRentals

      public static javafx.collections.ObservableList<MovieRental> loadRentals(File rentalFile)
      Load rentals list, accepting both string and numeric IDs and defaulting missing rentable flags to false to preserve compatibility.
      Parameters:
      rentalFile - source rentals JSON file
      Returns:
      ObservableList of MovieRental

    • saveStudents

      public static void saveStudents(File studentFile, List<Student> students)
      Save students to JSON file using their external string IDs.
      Parameters:
      studentFile - destination file
      students - list to persist

    • saveMembers

      public static void saveMembers(File memberFile, List<ExternalMember> members)
      Save external members to JSON file using their external string IDs.
      Parameters:
      memberFile - destination file
      members - list to persist

    • saveMovies

      public static void saveMovies(File movieFile, List<Movie> movies, List<MovieRental> rentals)
      Save movies to JSON file. The saved "id" is the external string ID, and availability is computed from current rentals.
      Parameters:
      movieFile - destination file
      movies - list of movies
      rentals - current rentals used to compute availability

    • saveRentals

      public static void saveRentals(File rentalFile, List<MovieRental> rentals)
      Save rentals to JSON file. Customer and movie IDs are saved using their external string IDs to preserve readability and version compatibility.
      Parameters:
      rentalFile - destination file
      rentals - list of MovieRental to persist
